plants.name: Rosa spp.
plants.description: Roses are iconic flowering shrubs known for their fragrant and often large, beautiful blossoms. Many cultivated garden varieties bloom profusely during summer months.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early fall (depending on variety)
plants.location: Widely cultivated; native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere
plants.funFact: Some rose species have been cultivated for over 5,000 years and have been symbols of love and beauty across many cultures.

plants.name: Lavandula angustifolia
plants.description: A woody shrub with narrow grey-green leaves and fragrant purple flower spikes. Lavender is widely grown for its scent and essential oils.
plants.location: Native to the Mediterranean but cultivated worldwide in temperate regions
plants.funFact: Lavender oil has antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties and has been used historically for healing and relaxation.

plants.name: Plumeria rubra
plants.description: A tropical tree known for its beautifully fragrant and waxy flowers, commonly used in Hawaiian leis.
plants.location: Native to Central America, commonly grown in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Plumeria flowers are often fragrant at night to attract moth pollinators.

plants.name: Arnica montana
plants.description: A wildflower found in mountainous areas with bright yellow daisy-like flowers, known for medicinal properties.
plants.location: Native to Europe in mountainous meadows and grasslands
plants.funFact: Arnica extract is used in herbal medicine to treat bruises, sprains, and muscle pain.
